title: White House press secretary defends Trump's tweet
description: CNN's Abby Phillip says White House press secretary Kayleigh McEnany's defense of President Donald Trump's tweet about a protester who was pushed over by police was "literally unbelievable" because there are no facts tied to it.

title: 'Gone With the Wind' temporarily pulled from HBO Max
description: HBO Max has temporarily pulled "Gone With the Wind" from its library due to "racist depictions." The 1939 film will eventually return to the service with "a denouncement of those very depictions."

title: 'All Lives Matter' protesters in New Jersey re-enacted Floyd's death in front of Black Lives Matter march
description: A group of people mockingly reenacted George Floyd's death at an "All Lives Matter" protest in front of a Black Lives Matter march on Monday in Franklinville, New Jersey.

title: Lawyer: DOJ dropping Flynn case is 'a gross abuse of prosecutorial power'
description: Former national security adviser Michael Flynn should be sentenced for lying, including perjuring himself in court, rather than have the charges against him dismissed, a court-appointed attorney and former judge said Wednesday.

title: Trump opposed to stripping Confederate names from US bases
description: President Donald Trump said Wednesday he opposes any effort by the US military to rename the nearly one dozen major bases and installations that bear the names of Confederate military commanders.

title: How the search for missing Idaho children went from parents in Hawaii to the discovery of human remains
description: When police discovered human remains on Chad Daybell's property, they may have taken a step closer to answering a question that family, friends and many others have been asking for months: where are Tylee Ryan and Joshua "JJ" Vallow?

title: UK rapper shares video of his father being Tasered by police
description: British rapper Wretch 32 says there has been "no progression" in the fight against police brutality in the UK, after sharing a video of his father being Tasered by officers at his home in north London.

title: 3 recordings. 3 cries of 'I can't breathe.' 3 black men dead after interactions with police
description: In the days since George Floyd's cries that he couldn't breathe tugged at the world's conscience, two similar deadly encounters involving police officers have come to wider public attention.

title: Disney fans say Splash Mountain should be re-themed
description: One of Disney's best-loved rides is based on a film widely considered the studio's most racist.

title: A 14-year-old boy with autism who went missing for 2 days on a mountain has been found
description: A 14-year-old boy who went missing in freezing conditions in Victoria, Australia, has been found.

title: 81-year-old movie pulled from HBO Max until it can return with 'historical context'
description: HBO Max has pulled "Gone with the Wind" from its library of films.

title: 13,500-year-old bird figurine could be prehistoric art's 'missing link'
description: A Stone Age bird sculpture uncovered in China may reshape our understanding of prehistoric art in Asia, according to researchers.

title: Republican senators watch Trump's eroding standing with unease
GOP senators watch Trump's eroding standing with unease
description:
• Analysis: What one Bush's endorsement of Trump says about GOP politics
• Analysis: Trump's remarkable polling collapse
• Trump campaign demands CNN apologize for poll that shows Biden leading

title: Why Anna Kendrick compares filming 'Twilight' to surviving a 'hostage situation'
description: "Twilight" devotees loved the movie but filming it was not much fun, according to Anna Kendrick.

title: Tyson Fury confirms two-fight deal to face Anthony Joshua
description: British world heavyweight champions Tyson Fury and Anthony Joshua are set to fight in 2021.

title: Alexa, Siri and Google Voice have new answers when asked about Black Lives Matter
description: Siri, Google, Alexa -- do black lives matter?

title: Why humans need touch, especially when we grieve
description: When we lose a loved one our physical connections are essential. A simple hug can be a powerful act of comfort. But during the coronavirus pandemic we often find ourselves alone, unable to seek solace from those closest to us.

title: 'Oh you must be heavy boned.' Marilyn Okoro's fight for body acceptance
description: She was comfortable with her body, though others were not.

title: George Floyd's brother tells lawmakers: 'He didn't deserve to die over $20'
description: George Floyd's brother, Philonise Floyd, will tell House lawmakers that his brother "didn't deserve to die over $20," asking them "is that what a black man's life is worth? Twenty dollars? This is 2020. Enough is enough."

title: Trump's VA is using veterans as guinea pigs to test his disproven hydroxychloroquine theory
description: The Department of Veterans Affairs could learn an important lesson from their colleagues at SpaceX and NASA after the historic launch to the International Space Station last month was initially postponed due to inclement weather. When there's a storm rolling in, you don't fly into it, no matter how much a powerful person looking on wants it to happen.

title: Fauci says the WHO's comment on asymptomatic spread is wrong
description: This novel coronavirus is bizarre for many reasons, making its spread unpredictable and hard to control.

title: Summer is here, and your mask is sweaty. Here's what to do about it
description: It's hot. You're sweaty. And if you're still coronavirus-conscious, then you're wearing your mask.

title: What George P. Bush's endorsement of Donald Trump tells us about Republican politics
description: President Donald Trump will have the vote of at least one member of the Bush clan this fall.

title: Alexis Ohanian asked to be replaced by a black candidate on Reddit's board. Reddit listened
US intercepts Russian bombers and fighter jets off coast of Alaska in international airspace
description: The United States intercepted Russian bombers and fighter jets off the coast of Alaska on Wednesday morning, according to North American Aerospace Defense Command.

title: L'Oreal dropped this model for commenting on racism. Now it wants her back.
description: L'Oreal has asked model Munroe Bergdorf to advise the company on diversity and inclusion, three years after it dropped her for comments about systemic racism.

title: Police blame gangs and local groups for riot damages, contradicting Trump's claims
description: The police chief of Bellevue, Washington, was patrolling downtown on a Sunday afternoon late last month as a crowd of what appeared to be peaceful protesters gathered with signs bearing the name of George Floyd, the black man who had died days earlier at the hands of a Minneapolis police officer.

title: Archaeologists think they've found London's oldest theater
description: A team of archaeologists may have discovered the oldest purpose-built theater in London beneath a construction site in Whitechapel.

title: 'Choose Your Own Fake News' game wants to tackle misinformation
description: Africa like many other parts of the world has witnessed a recent rise in the spread of misinformation.

title: CNN anchor: This makes us squirm, but it's killing us
description: CNN's Don Lemon says Rev. Al Sharpton's eulogy confronted reality that racism killed George Floyd and that truth will make a lot of Americans uncomfortable.

title: 1945 wants to know what the heck is going on
description: 1945 called. It wants to know what the heck is going on.

title: See global design competition to help fight Covid-19
description: From soap tattoos to self-cleaning lockers, top colleges have submitted proposals to combat the Coronavirus in an emergency edition of Art Dubai Group's Global Grad Show.

title: North Korea might be making millions  -- and breaking sanctions -- selling sand. Yes, sand.
description: It was May of last year when Lucas Kuo and Lauren Sung noticed something strange: more than 100 ships gathering in the waters near Haeju, North Korea.

title: Black people are largely ignored by the travel industry, but that hasn't kept us home
description: As part of the Black Lives Matter movement, protesters recently looped a rope around the Confederate Soldiers and Sailors Monument in Birmingham, Alabama, and tried to drag it to the ground. The statue had long irked many locals, but a state law prohibits the removal of any Confederate monuments like this one.

title: Statues fall as Britain faces bitter reckoning
description: On Sunday, Black Lives Matter protesters in Bristol, UK, pulled down a statue of 17th-century slave trader Edward Colston and rolled it through the streets before dumping it, unceremoniously, into the River Avon.

title: Former astronaut becomes first woman to visit lowest point on Earth
description: Just eight people have reached Challenger Deep, the deepest point of the ocean. More than 550 people have visited space.

title: Floyd's longtime friend reveals prophetic comment in 11th grade
description: Thousands gathered in Houston, Texas, Tuesday to bid a final farewell to George Floyd -- the man whose last moments sparked outrage and protests across the country.

title: The 'Covid-free' Italian town selling $1 houses
description: The global pandemic has put a halt to many travel experiences, including the rush to snap up Italian homes at bargain prices, but now that some places are emerging from restrictions, the country's one-dollar home bonanza seems to be back on.

title: Fellow Africans, it is time for us to check our own race privilege
description: "Why didn't you tell me, mummy? I'm so upset!"

title: Banksy proposes a new statue that will make 'everyone happy'
description: It was only a matter of time before Banksy weighed in.

title: My journey with body image in athletics
description: Marilyn Okoro is an Olympic bronze medal-winning sprinter, but she's had a life filled with people criticizing her body. How did this happen throughout her career?

title: China flexes military muscle amid coronavirus pandemic
description: As the world is distracted by the Covid-19 pandemic, China appears to be making bold military moves on multiple fronts, causing experts to warn of the tension between the US and China. CNN's David Culver reports.

title: Police officer fired and charged after fatally choking a man during an arrest, police say
description: A New Mexico police officer is out of a job and facing an involuntary manslaughter charge after he allegedly used a vascular neck restraint on a man during a traffic stop.

title: The story behind Trump's conspiracy theory tweet
description: In an unsubstantiated claim, President Donald Trump tweeted, without evidence, that a 75-year-old man who was seriously injured after being shoved by police officers in Buffalo, New York, may have been part of a "set up." CNN's Brian Stelter explains how Trump came to retweet that claim.

title: Friend of man shoved by police 'horrified' by Trump's tweet
description: President Trump suggested in a baseless tweet that 75-year-old Martin Gugino, who was seriously injured after being shoved by police officers in Buffalo, New York, may have been part of a "set up." His friend Keith Giles says anyone who knows Gugino would find that theory to be "extremely hilarious."

title: Will people still flock to theaters in wake of pandemic?
description: Sony Motion Pictures Chairman Tom Rothman told CNN's Chloe Melas that he thinks people will be more excited to get out of their house to go to the movie theater after the coronavirus pandemic forced some theaters to close.
